```{r}

```

``` {r}
#Read LSAc SPSS files in R
tudb10 <- read_sav("Z:/LSAC dataset/General Release/TUDs/SPSS/tudb10.sav")
tudb12 <- read_sav("Z:/LSAC dataset/General Release/TUDs/SPSS/tudb12.sav")
tudb14 <- read_sav("Z:/LSAC dataset/General Release/TUDs/SPSS/tudb14.sav")
```

``` {r}
#Select relevant columns for each TUD
relevantcols10 <- tudb10 %>% 
  select(hicid, loop, awake, bed, sleep, stime, mainact, actlab, secact1, secact2, secact3)
relevantcols12 <- tudb12 %>% 
  select(hicid, loop, awake, bed, sleep, stime, mainact, actlab, secact1, secact2, secact3)
relevantcols14 <- tudb14 %>% 
  select(hicid, loop, awake, bed, sleep, stime, mainact, secact1, secact2, secact3)


```

``` {r}
#Calculate time spent in each behaviour per diary
relevantcols10 %>% 
#Group activites by participant 
  group_by(hicid) %>% 
#Subtract start time from one activity from the next activity
  mutate(totaltime = lead(stime) - stime) %>% 
#Problem: Replace 'NA secs' (which will be the last activity of the day) with the function (sleep - stime) to determine time spent in final activity of the day
  #I couldn't figure this out... this is what I attempted

  #Attempt 2:ifelse(is.na(mutate(totaltime = lead(stime) - stime)), (sleep - stime), print())
#Convert secs into minutes
  mutate(minutes = minute(seconds_to_period(totaltime)))
```

``` {r}
#Code from 19JULY2020
#Calculate time spent in each behaviour for TUD10
d10 <- relevantcols10 %>% 
#Group activities by participant 
  group_by(hicid) %>% 
#Assign start time of following actives as "end time", make numeric so later on times that occur after midnight can be subtracted without becoming negative
  mutate(end_time_num = as.numeric(lead(stime))) %>%
#Make start and sleep times as numeric to avoid negative midnight problem 
  mutate(start_time_num = as.numeric(stime)) %>%
  mutate(sleep_time_num = as.numeric(sleep)) %>% 
  mutate(awake_time_num = as.numeric(awake))
#Assign last activities of the day to be NA since they don't have a time to be subtracted from 
before_sleep <- is.na(d10$end_time_num)
#sleep_midnight <- (d$sleep_time_num == 0) + 86400 (This was an attempt to solve the problem at the end of this chunk. Some end_times were incorrect)
#Assign sleep time to be end time for last activities of the day
d10$end_time_num[before_sleep] <- (d10$sleep_time_num[before_sleep])
#Add "1 day" to end times that occur after midnight 
next_day_finish <- (d10$end_time_num < d10$start_time_num) & !is.na(d10$end_time_num)
#table(next_day_finish)
d10$end_time_num[next_day_finish] <- (d10$end_time_num[next_day_finish] + 86400)
#Subtract start time from end time to get the total time spent in each activity 
d10$total_time_num <- d10$end_time_num - d10$start_time_num
#hist(d$total_time_num)
#Assign typos as "NA", these will not be used in analysis; determined by activities that were >12 hours in length
d10$total_time_num[d10$total_time_num > 43200] <- NA  
#Convert total time from seconds to minutes 
d10$total_minutes <- d10$total_time_num %/% 60
d10

```

``` {r}
#Calculate Nighttime Sleep 
#Make variable for subjects who went to sleep before midnight
d10$sleep_time_num

#Make variable for subjects who went to sleep after midnight 
sleep_after_midnight <- !is.na(d10$sleep_time_num) & d10$sleep_time_num <= 43200

#For subjects who went to sleep before midnight, subtract their sleep time from 86400 
sleep_to_midnight_calculation <- 86400 - d10$sleep_time_num[sleep_before_midnight]
total_sleep_before_midnight <- d10$awake_time_num[sleep_before_midnight] + sleep_to_midnight_calculation
d10$sleep_time_num[sleep_before_midnight] <- total_sleep_before_midnight
hist(total_sleep_before_midnight)

total_sleep_after_midnight <- d10$awake_time_num[sleep_after_midnight] - d10$sleep_time_num[sleep_after_midnight]
d10$sleep_time_num[sleep_after_midnight] <- total_sleep_after_midnight
hist(total_sleep_after_midnight)

nighttime_sleep <- c(total_sleep_after_midnight, total_sleep_before_midnight) / 60

basic_sleep_calculation <- d10$awake_time_num - d10$sleep_time_num
final_sleep_after_midnight <- basic_sleep_calculation[basic_sleep_calculation>0]
basic_sleep_negatives <- basic_sleep_calculation[basic_sleep_calculation <0]

 
 
  
 

 
 long_d10 %>%

  ungroup() %>%
  distinct(domain_main_activity, domain_secondary1_activity, domain_secondary2_activity, domain_secondary3_activity)
names(wide_d10)
```

``` {r} 
#Code from 20JULY2020
#Calculate time spent in each behaviour for TUd12
d12 <- relevantcols12 %>% 
#Group activities by participant 
  group_by(hicid) %>% 
#Assign start time of following actives as "end time", make numeric so later on times that occur after midnight can be subtracted without becoming negative
  mutate(end_time_num = as.numeric(lead(stime))) %>%
#Make start and sleep times as numeric to avoid negative midnight problem 
  mutate(start_time_num = as.numeric(stime)) %>%
  mutate(sleep_time_num = as.numeric(sleep))
#Assign last activities of the day to be NA since they don't have a time to be subtracted from 
before_sleep <- is.na(d12$end_time_num)
#sleep_midnight <- (d$sleep_time_num == 0) + 86400 (This was an attempt to solve the problem at the end of this chunk. Some end_times were incorrect)
#Assign sleep time to be end time for last activities of the day
d12$end_time_num[before_sleep] <- (d12$sleep_time_num[before_sleep])
#Add "1 day" to end times that occur after midnight 
next_day_finish <- (d12$end_time_num < d12$start_time_num) & !is.na(d12$end_time_num)
#table(next_day_finish)
d12$end_time_num[next_day_finish] <- (d12$end_time_num[next_day_finish] + 86400)
#Subtract start time from end time to get the total time spent in each activity 
d12$total_time_num <- d12$end_time_num - d12$start_time_num
#hist(d$total_time_num)
#Assign typos as "NA", these will not be used in analysis; determined by activities that were >12 hours in length
d12$total_time_num[d12$total_time_num > 43200] <- NA  
#Convert total time from seconds to minutes 
d12$total_minutes <- d12$total_time_num %/% 60
d12
```

``` {r}
  #Combine domain-specific movement behaviours into overall, general movement behaviour (i.e., light-intensity physical activity, MVPA, sedentary behaviour, sleep)
  mutate(general_movement_behaviour = case_when(
    domain_specific_movement_behaviour %in% c("Unstructured Leisure Time Light-Intensity Physical Activity", "Work and Household Light-Intensity Physical Activity") ~ "Light-Intensity Physical Activity",
    domain_specific_movement_behaviour %in% c("Active Transportation", "Unstructured Leisure Time Moderate- to Vigorous- Intensity Physical Activity", "Structured Leisure Time Moderate- to Vigorous- Intensity Physical Activity") ~ "Moderate- to Vigorous- Intensity Physical Activity",
    domain_specific_movement_behaviour %in% c("Leisure Time Sedentary Behaviour", "Education-Based Sedentary Behaviour", "Passive Transportation", "Recreational Screen Time", "Social-Based Sedentary Behaviour", "Self Care Sedentary Behaviour") ~ "Sedentary Behaviour",
    domain_specific_movement_behaviour %in% "Daytime Naps" ~ "Sleep",
    domain_specific_movement_behaviour %in% "Uncodeable Activity" ~ "Uncodeable"
    
  ))  
%>% 
 wide_d12 %>%  dcast(hicid ~ c(domain_specific_movement_behaviour, general_movement_behaviour), value.var="total_minutes", fun.aggregate = sum) 
  #Problem: I need to add my nighttimte_sleep calculation from above as a separate column and then combine it with daytime naps to get total "Sleep #"mutate(subject_nighttime_sleep = distinct(nighttime_sleep))
wide_d12 %>% 
  filter(is.na(domain_specific_movement_behaviour)) %>% 
  ungroup() %>%
  distinct(domain_main_activity, domain_secondary1_activity, domain_secondary2_activity, domain_secondary3_activity)
```

``` {r} 
#Code from 20JULY2020
#Calculate time spent in each behaviour for TUd14
d14 <- relevantcols14 %>% 
#Group activities by participant 
  group_by(hicid) %>% 
#Assign start time of following actives as "end time", make numeric so later on times that occur after midnight can be subtracted without becoming negative
  mutate(end_time_num = as.numeric(lead(stime))) %>%
#Make start and sleep times as numeric to avoid negative midnight problem 
  mutate(start_time_num = as.numeric(stime)) %>%
  mutate(sleep_time_num = as.numeric(sleep))
#Assign last activities of the day to be NA since they don't have a time to be subtracted from 
before_sleep <- is.na(d14$end_time_num)
#sleep_midnight <- (d$sleep_time_num == 0) + 86400 (This was an attempt to solve the problem at the end of this chunk. Some end_times were incorrect)
#Assign sleep time to be end time for last activities of the day
d14$end_time_num[before_sleep] <- (d14$sleep_time_num[before_sleep])
#Add "1 day" to end times that occur after midnight 
next_day_finish <- (d14$end_time_num < d14$start_time_num) & !is.na(d14$end_time_num)
#table(next_day_finish)
d14$end_time_num[next_day_finish] <- (d14$end_time_num[next_day_finish] + 86400)
#Subtract start time from end time to get the total time spent in each activity 
d14$total_time_num <- d14$end_time_num - d14$start_time_num
#hist(d$total_time_num)
#Assign typos as "NA", these will not be used in analysis; determined by activities that were >12 hours in length
d14$total_time_num[d14$total_time_num > 43200] <- NA  
#Convert total time from seconds to minutes 
d14$total_minutes <- d14$total_time_num %/% 60
d14
```

``` {r}
  ))
```
